Hi everyone,
> > Just FYI, Code Warior is actully an IDE, not a compiler (I don't know
what
>  compiler it uses).  Also, MS Visual C++ is generally reguarded as one of
the
>  best IDE's out there; if you've got that you may want to give it another
try.
>
> I tried to understand a simple "Hello World" program written in that
language and had difficulty.  Maybe it's because it's truly object
> oriented and I haven't had a truely object oriented programming class.  It
might be easier after I've had studied true object oriented
> programming.

Traditional 4 or 5 line hello world programs work fine in it, you just have
to create a console application project.
It can compile C and C++ quite happily, nothing restricts you to a 'pure OO'
style :)

The key thing is the console app. project - make sure you create one of
those and you're set.
Gladiator should compile quite happily in it too :)

- Deathifier
